metadata.title: CVE-2023-4863 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in libwebp in Google Chrome prior to 116.0.5845.187and libwebp 1.3.2 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of boundsmemory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity:Critical)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwebp7 - 1.2.4-0.2ubuntu1
libwebpdemux2 - 1.2.4-0.2ubuntu1
libwebpmux3 - 1.2.4-0.2ubuntu1
webp - 1.2.4-0.2ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libwebp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-0.2ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.2.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
